blocks.text: Privacy Policy
**Last updated**: Dec 16, 2025

Drumee (“Drumee”, “we”, “our”, or “us”) is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains what information we process, how we protect it, and the choices you have when using Drumee.
Drumee is designed as a **privacy-first cloud workspace**. We do not exploit user data, and we do not use your content for advertising, profiling, or any secondary purposes.
1. Our Privacy Principles
Drumee is built on the following principles:

items: We do not analyze or monetize your content
We collect only the minimum data required to operate the service
You remain in control of access and sharing at all times

blocks.text: 2. What Data We Do NOT Collect
Drumee does **not**:

items: Track user behavior for advertising or marketing
Access your content for internal review or manual inspection

blocks.text: 3. Data We Process (Minimal & Necessary)
We process only the minimum technical and account-related data required to provide the service.
3.1 Account Information
This data is used solely for authentication, account management, and communication related to the service.
3.2 User Content
User content includes files, folders, messages, notes, and other information you choose to upload or create.

items: You retain full ownership of all user content
Drumee does not interpret, analyze, or navigate through this content
Content is processed only to store, transmit, and display it at your request

blocks.text: 3.3 Technical Data
Limited technical data may be processed for:
This data does not include behavioral profiling or content analysis.
4. Legal Basis for Processing (GDPR)
For users in the European Union, Drumee processes data under the following legal bases:

items: **Contractual necessity** – to provide the service you request
**Explicit user consent** – for any processing beyond core service operation

blocks.text: 5. Data Sharing
Drumee does not share your personal data or content with third parties, except:

items: When required by law or lawful government request
With trusted infrastructure providers strictly necessary to operate the service (e.g. hosting, security), under confidentiality agreements

blocks.text: No third party is permitted to use your data for their own purposes.
6. Data Security
We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your data, including:
Despite these measures, no system can be guaranteed 100% secure.
7. Data Retention

items: User content is retained as long as your account is active
You may delete content at any time
Upon account termination, data may be deleted in accordance with applicable laws and operational requirements

blocks.text: 8. Your Rights
Depending on your location, you may have the right to:
Requests can be made by contacting us at the email below.
9. International Users
Drumee is operated under French law. If you access the service from outside France or the European Union, your data may be processed in jurisdictions with different data protection laws.
We take steps to ensure adequate protection in accordance with applicable regulations.
10. Changes to This Policy
We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time.
If changes are material, we will notify users through the service or by email. Continued use of Drumee after changes become effective constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.
11. Contact Us
If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or your data, please contact us at:
**Email**: fren@drumee.org
By using Drumee, you acknowledge that you have read and understood this Privacy Policy.
